news_header: Environmental organizations argue that Japan's new emission reduction targets are insufficient. The government aims to cut climate emissions by 60% from 2013 levels, but critics say this falls short of the Paris Agreement requirements.
news_original_title: Japani asetti uudet tavoitteet ilmastopäästöjen vähentämiselle
news_text: Japan's previous target was a 46% reduction by 2030, and it plans to rely more on renewable energy by 2040. Activists like 360.org demand an 81% reduction by 2035.
